alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Lawrence; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 12 at 10:54AM EST until December 14 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour affecting Washington, Jackson and Lawrence Counties. .Rainfall since Friday of about one inch brought 5-day rainfall totals up to around two inches...which has lead to localized flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Seymour. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Lowland flood continues. Jackson County Road 700 E begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Sunday was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 6.7 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1100 PM EST.
